review_text: It's the Taunton river, so swimmers beware.. for a boat ride its great... I've even seen plenty of people fish there.. The battleship sits in its water,  you can even take a sailing class or two.. you can walk along the river, stop at one of the establishments & listen to some of the live bands during the summer months.
Beautiful views but the water is murky and has lots of creatures hovering around the shore lines
Very serene atmosphere.
Very beautiful and serene!
A place away from the city that is quiet and tranquil. Love going to fish.
Very beautiful, lots of birds and fish
My friends have a house on this river! Very pretty!

Most of the Tauton River is very nice.
There are a few fishing spots left after Arc Bait takes every poggie out of the river.
But really nice place for kayaking and such.

Great place to bring the kids to play! It's my son's 8th birthday and he's having a blast.

We did have an incident where an older boy was being very rough with my son in the ball pit.. he was diving on him, pulled his hair.. I feel so bad for this to happen on his birthday.
The employee asked the boy what happened and of course the little boy said that my son had hit him but, when I told the boy's father and the employee what happened face to face then the little boy apologized and the father wasn't too happy with the situation but it is what it is. I told him how the ball pit is empty now because everyone is hiding from his son and people pulling their children out because of him.
The employee should've said stay out of the play area..

They need to handle situations better.

I had my daughter's birthday party here this past Sunday, and Shayla was the one helping me with everything I needed. She was amazing! She checked in every 5-10 minutes to see if we needed more drinks. There was a mix-up on how many pizzas I ordered, and she ensured we got the extra 2 I had ordered. She was the sweetest! My daughter had a blast with her friends, and I couldn't say anything negative about this place. Thank you, Shayla!

Took my 3.5 year old here to burn off some energy.. not sure who's more tired.  Entry prices are very reasonable (we did the 1.5hr). He absolutely loves the ball and foam pit and has done 300 laps on the mini trampoline course. Even as an adult, I still enjoyed joining in all his craziness. Place is very clean as well.
The only thing I don't care for is the price of the arcade. Most games cost 6-8 points and for an example, the middle card is only 80 points (I think it's like ~$40).
There are snacks and drinks, but I've seen nearly everyone bringing their own coolers!

Overall, We had a blast!

I do not recommend this venue for birthday parties. While the place is fantastic for kids, offering a fun and diverse range of activities, it becomes overly crowded. We reserved a room for a birthday party, expecting a party host as promised. Our host, Olivia, was not as helpful as anticipated. Upon arrival, she instructed us to send the kids to her for wristbands, but the socks, which were supposed to be distributed by her, were left in the room for us to handle.

During pizza time, we encountered a shortage of water and juice, with only 5 bottles of each for 10 children. Olivia placed a few pizza slices on plates and then left the room. The pizza was cold and stale by the time it was served, and Olivia was absent, failing to assist with serving the pizza, cutting the cake, or cleaning up afterwards.

Moreover, our time felt rushed as Olivia began setting up for the next party while we were still with our guests, indicating insufficient time allocated between parties. We were also given the responsibility to distribute cards to the children. The service was severely lacking throughout the event. Furthermore, Olivia repeatedly pressured us to settle the bill/check out, interrupting the party to ask about payment four times, leading to an uncomfortable situation where we had to check out amidst the celebration. Overall, the experience was marred by poor service and inadequate hosting.

We love Fun City, so much for the kids to do and really for any age!! It's clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. I enjoy bringing my grandchildren there and knowing they are running around and having so much fun I definitely enjoy knowing they are not sitting at home on their phones or tablets!!! The place is plenty big with something for everyone to enjoy, they even have bumper cars now which the kids loved!!! I would definitely recommend going there and checking it out for yourself,I don't think you'll be disappointed. You do buy socks there which are yours to keep and bring each time you go,I clean them and keep them in my car just case you decide to go you'll have them!!! Go check it out and have some fun

Do not host any parties here!! Terrible service. They steal from you and then the manager Tina will laugh in your face when you catch on. In a 15 minute span a child was taken out in an ambulance due to no one watching on the jump floor and 2 cops were called to deal with the manager Tina. Very disappointing service, higher a better manager to start who knows how to deal with problems. Not someone who laughs and throws their hands in your face. They charged much more than the package cost and did not give us the full hour and a half, instead we only got 1 hour. So in the end we paid more, got less and got terrible customer service as well. I'm sorry for anyone who has to deal with Tina. She is the furthest thing from helpful, the security guard and police officers didn't even know how to respond to her ignorance. Hire better workers if you want this to stay a successful business. Not to mention being over capacity. This place is extremely dirty and unsafe. Any other trampoline/adventure park in Massachusetts is a better option. DO NOT GO HERE!

This place is amazing for most people with or without kids. It has a large area of trampolines with different challenges and features for different age groups. Also features a play area dedicated for kids of different ages that includes slides of different types and other features for climbing and tunnels. Has an area for arcade games and 4 areas for rock climbing based on skill levels. Also includes a dedicated zip line section for ages 3 and above. Highly recommend this place for a fun family outing!
2h well spent to get the kids the funs and  burn the calories lol. Lots of activities. Come here to explore. Crowded even on the week day.

Wow we had so much fun at the ice skating rink! The camp looks amazing. People were very friendly and it made my sons weekend! We will definitely go back.

Update: we did go back in the summertime. The camp is amazing. Swimming, splash pad, archery, rock climbing wall. So many fun things to do with the kids it was awesome again.
response_from_owner_text: Jamie, we are so glad to hear how much you've enjoyed our services, staff, and amenities! We value your feedback and are so grateful to have such a wonderful patron enjoying what we have to offer! Thank you!

review_text: My son LOVED Camp Riverside! It was his first year attending and he wanted to go every single day, even though I told him 3 days each week I was home during the day. I told him he could take days off if he didn't feel like going, or if he was tired, didn't feel good, etc. Not like school, just stay home if you feel like it. He skipped 1 day cuz he was tired and never again. Didn't want to miss a day, even when it was raining. 5 stars for sure!
response_from_owner_text: So glad he had a great summer with us! Hope he'll be back this year!

review_text: My 5 year old son loves going to this camp! I would of given it 5 stars I just wish they would help my son make sure he has everything when it's time to leave I know it's kind of a lot to ask but he's only 5 and just needs another pair of eyes sometimes but honestly that's the only issue I have. Other than that the camp is awesome has great things for kids to do!!!!! So glad we get the opportunity to go!!!
response_from_owner_text:
Thank you for providing valuable feedback to the Camp Riverside team! We're thrilled to hear that your Goldfish camper is loving his time spent at camp.

We are continuing to work on our lost & found efforts and supporting our staff team in ensuring our youngest campers have the help they need to keep track of their things throughout the day. Happy camping!

- The Camp Riverside Team

review_text: what parent would recommend this camp when the children aren't allowed to use the bathroom or go to the nurse without three other children needing to do the same in their group. You have two children running around looking for a third child that needs to use the bathroom. It was never like this! So in return your child has to hold their blatter or bowels if three kids in their group don't have to use the bathroom or even go to the nurse office!!! what if your child was injured and needed a nurse do you try and find two other non injured children to bring the one that's injured to the nurse. Absolutely insane, for all the parents that didn't know now you know! Unfortunately I wouldn't even give a 1 star!
response_from_owner_text:
Thank you for providing valuable feedback to the Camp Riverside team. In accordance with our Child Protection Policy, campers are never alone with a staff member, or with another camper; our staff is trained to follow the "rule of three" to ensure transparency and constant supervision and to prevent peer-to-peer child abuse.

In an emergency, our Camp Health Care Center is equipped with an all-terrain golf car so that campers may be reached safely and quickly from anywhere on the property. We appreciate your response and are always working to create the safest and most engaging summer experience for our members.

review_text:
We stopped in for family fun day.
It was well organized fun.
The campus is a pretty good size,well kept & lots of fun to be had
response_from_owner_text: Fawn, thank you for joining us at Family Fun Day! We hope to see you again soon!

review_text: The camp grounds are rich pieces of actual camp! Kids get to enjoy many outdoor activities along having fun in the sun. They also allow l.i.t and c.i.t programs for future counselors for 13-15 year olds. I'm personally working there this summer of 2021 and glady hope to bring positive energy to the kids after coming from the pandemic!

Very disappointed that the staff will not return my phone calls.. My daughter has been attending traditional day camp there for the past 3 years and a problem with their website is causing her to miss the majority of the summer. Nobody will return calls or emails
Live next door. Never an issue.

Very nice , quiet , safe , beautiful Forest.
Camp fire all day all evening.
Nice swimming, nice fishing spots , nice trails.
Rangers patrol almost hourly. Especially in the evenings. Met one she was  very nice and helpful.

Wow, Cranberry bog!  Can't get more local/regional then that and you don't need any more reason then that to visit. No charge to just walk or bike the trails. 6 mile loop (and mostly flat) is perfect for a good stretch of the legs. Points off for the lack of signage along the trails. Struggled a bit to stay on the right path.

Very quiet campground. Many trails to bike and/or hike. Nice swimming area with a walking path around it.  Be prepared to follow the only 2 visitor rule though, meaning only the same 2 people can visit you during your stay and they have to be out by 8pm. They are strict on this State rule.

Great place to stay However I have noticed many homeless people due to the crazy recession great playground great fishing campsites are decent to some are a little small overall I do recommend this place for a weekend getaway if you live in the area

Awesome hiking trails! We customize based on how much time we have to spend hiking. We've done as few as 5 miles and as much as 11 miles in one day. Beautiful views. Be prepared for mud in spring and summer and you'll be just fine.

I knew that RV sites were limited to water and electricity at an additional cost per day but I expected restrooms to be better.  A basic shower facility in our A camp ring building and it is pretty run down.   I used the shower once and it took the hot water several minutes to become lukewarm.  Due to poor facility,  we used our RV showers and toilet  more which caused us to Dump more than expected.  Dump facility is just outside the camping area on the main road and was accessible from either side of the Dump tube. Campgrounds had 4 dumpsters centrally located but no other trash cans around the campsites.  A NO VISITORS policy is strictly enforced at the Campgrounds which I don't understand as we were visiting from 1500 miles away.  The rules should be changed to limit parties or groups no  larger than 8 adults.  Lastly,  non Massachusetts residents pay at least 2 1/2 times the resident rate. It seems the park is more for tent camping than RV campers.  I doubt I will return to this park in the future, it's design is pointed at weekend tent campers, not 7 to 14 day RV camping.
My happy place. Beautiful trails and playground! It's also our favorite place to camp!

I desperately want to love this place as it is local and I've been coming here for a long time, even when it was closed down. Unfortunately I just can't recommend this place.
There's some peculiarities to this campground that I've never seen before. First of all, they have a very strict no visitor policy. If you are not on the reservation you are not allowed in the campground. Most of the campsites are okay but there are a few that are literally so slanted you could not even pitch a tent yet alone park your car..
The pond has a iron algae bloom and makes the water have this very strange oil slick appearance. It's completely harmless but I'm sure to some people is concerning. If you're allergic to pollen, stay away as it gets pretty brutal.
The next thing is the very noticeable amount of homeless people who are living in this campground. There were very clearly three obvious ones when we arrived on Friday night and this morning a police escort of three cruisers came to basically kick these people out. They had a microwave, a mattress and everything. There are people that will run extension cords out of the bathroom outlets and have surge protectors plugged in with all of their phones and accessories charging. You can only buy firewood with a credit card and not by cash which is probably the only place I've ever seen do that. The people that come here are completely ignorant and use the driving road as a walking path and literally will not move out of your way when you're trying to drive back to your site. As I wrote this I also noticed a couple Nice big widowmakers as we call them. Dead branches that are either already broken off and just hanging on other branches or ones that will come down very soon. These are extremely dangerous and should be taken down by the park staff, it's really not that hard..

No of course it's not all bad. It was relatively quiet this weekend aside from one spot that was being a little loud. The pond is great to fish in and of course it's close to home, this price is per night are also very reasonable for a tent site.

If you're looking for a actual camping experience, drive an hour away either to New Hampshire Connecticut and you will find yourself in a much better situation than this.

The city did a great job this year with their Christmas decorations. Me and my family went to the Green and really enjoyed ourselves. I would suggest anyone consider coming through when there are seasonal events taking place.

Taunton Green is a cool little park to visit. There are lots of historical plaques and statues. The area is very historic as well. Walking along the green is a cool experience taking in the massive buildings and cool fountain.

This is a wonderful spot to hang out for a few hours, during the day, or holiday night. The lawn is in pristine condition, well watered and cut. The fountain is clean and always flowing. The area seems well taken care of with little or no litter. It a great place to watch the sun disappear behind the great Taunton Post Office. It appears the locals respect this location and take good care of it! It was a pleasure to visit. The nearby food shops are a welcome sight after chilling for an hour.

We went to the Downtown Taunton Pumpkin Extravaganza and it was awesome! There were some great pumpkins and detailed scarecrows lining the green and it made for a great walk on a beautiful night ! While walking we also explored some of the Downtown area and really enjoyed some of the beauty of the city.

Taunton green center square of taunton where you can get food, products, hair cuts and home or personal bussiness taken care of. Taunton known as the Christmas city as seen is also know for being called silver city. The Taunton green is full of history from start to finish and not a bad place to sit for lunch and see all the plaques

Beautiful, fresh trees, sparkling lights, Christmas music, lovely Santa.
If you have children or even if you don't Taunton Green is magical this time of year. A must. A+
Great job with Christmas decorations this year
Nice. Short stroll. Fer some reason being the "Christmas City", I expected more.

We attended a memorial remembrance fo a relative. It was a beautiful day . If you are handicapped you don't have to pay for parking, otherwise there is a parking meter to use. Our get together was in the stone pavilion which was a great size with a roof and pretty view of the water and trees. However, if handicapped, it was a long bumpy walk whether it was across a grassy field or stony walkway.  We brought our service dog without a hitch from anyone or at least one other dog.  Plenty of room for kids to play, even playing ball. There was a ranger available , if needed. Very pleasant day!

Beautiful spot that we used to LOVE..Staff now closes early and let's ppl play outrageous loud music. We used to love comi g summer afternoons AFTER work last year
From 330 to about6..now they come around starting at 5 telling g us closing time is 530..close restrooms early.pick and choose what we can do.clise even the play ground amd don't allow on street parking after but ALWAYS USED TO..so sad

Attended a great party. The kids had a blast
The gazebo was really nice to use for the party. The children loved swimming ;.
There were 4 attendants by the bathroom, and all 4 of them sat in chairs the whole time we werefz1 there. ?? There were plenty of things I'm sure they were supposed to be doing. working?
They charge $8.00 to park which is fine but they don't take cash. The beach had goose poop that could have been raked up. Water was ok and playground was nice. Not as nice as it could be.

Watson Pond State Park in Taunton is a peaceful spot to enjoy a variety of outdoor activities! Perfect for families, there is a playground and an area for swimming. Great for outdoor enthusiasts- they offer grills to make a barbecue, you can go fishing or kayaking, or take your dog for a quiet walk in the woods. Whatever outdoor activity you enjoy, Watson Pond State Park is the best spot in Taunton!!

However, please be advised that they charge an $8 parking fee for MA residents or $20 for non-MA residents...that is the only downside. Otherwise, it was a perfect family day! Clean facilities. If you are looking for camping, please check out in Massasoit State Park, Taunton

Nice place to take the kids for sure. They have a playground which is right near the beach. Everything is close to each other.  The bathrooms are clean. They have picnic tables near the beach and in the wooded areas. There are charcoal grills or you can bring your own. It's 8 dollars to park. You have to use a card to pay to park. The machine doesn't take money. Bring swim shoes the beach is very rocky. Park rangers are nice and friendly. There isn't a life guard on site. There are fishing spots off to the sides of the swimming beach. You can also bring your canoe and paddle boats. I'm not sure about motorized boats. Definitely a nice alternative to the beach on days that cooler near the ocean, but warm inland and its close to home. Only thing missing in my opinion is a ice cream shack. LOL

It was great there! Not too many people. There is a playground and a beach area also bathrooms and a pavilion that you can hold parties at. There are also various picnic tables throughout the park. It was so nice there, very kid friendly environment. No pets allowed near the beach as far as I know. Plenty of wildlife to see.
This is a surprisingly nice park.  Nice little 'mini Beach' which is popular among most of the people that go.  Plenty of parking which is 8 dollars.

Pretty scenery, and well maintained but very noisy. The water treatment plant is a soothing kind of noisy, but when you get onto the trails, all you can hear is the nearby schoolchildren as if they were right there in the trail with you.

Won't be back there  Came across a car deep in the path while walking my golden retriever. When I got closer I saw somebody in the car that seemed passed out and wouldn't answer to me knocking in the window. I called 911 and walked away, will not be going there again.

I am so disappointed that my son went from the beautiful little league fields of Taunton to the unkept fields run by parks and rec.  It's embarrassing to watch them play on grass up to their knees this week at Martin School and a half mowed field at the Weir.  Our youth deserves better.

I went to the tauton town pool today at the hopewell park I was very dissatisfied I feel the life guards are not friendly at all there was very few that were like maybe a handful was very nice and down to earth other then that they seemed to not be so kid friendly n working in the community with a lot of kids around u would think that would be a little friendly I get they need to do there job but not be so dam grumpy doing it one of the guys told me my son would not be able to come back cuz he cant listen but I think I did more of the talk to my son then they did I watch my son the hole time cuz I know how my son can be and how he needs my full guidance because of him having a disability that make his act out a lot but I could understand if I was not there watching him but I was fully watching my son the entire time they blew there whistles a few time but after I was already over there  recommande him I think there should be places that is autism and adhd friendly this is one place I dont reccomend at all ....
They do a great job taking care of the grounds and events that the families use for enjoyment. Also run a lot of additional events for everyone.
Thank you for caring about the children
Very quiet and undisturbed besides the noise from the road close by....
Nice quiet park , and old bridge

Very fun! I wish the music was a little more diverse but I enjoy coming here on Friday nights. Everyone is so nice and it's more of an old school atmosphere which I personally prefer. I plan on coming here frequently! Price of food and entry is very reasonable. I love the fact that there is a skate shop on site! That's a unique feature of this location.

We absolutely loved our first visit to Forrest's: very welcoming feel, beautiful smooth large wooden floor, plenty of seating, great mixture of music & great sound system, huge parking lot, clean bathrooms & working water fountain. Thank you Forrest for a wonderful evening! Keep up the great work!
Great time! Took my son to rollerblade for the first time, he loved it! Definitely will be returning! Affordable clean fun

Great family fun!! The music is hit songs from the 70's-to modern hits. Great atmosphere.  Took my niece for her first time roller skating and we were back the very next day!! Prices are fair. They do have an arcade setup and party reserved area as well. All in all I highly recommend Forrest fun to all ages. Flashbacks are free, when u look around and its 1984 again..yeah that vibe..

Great skating rink in Taunton Ma.  Met the owner Forrest, he was so nice and the staff was  extremely friendly. The floor is like butter (which mean ALOT to jam and speed skaters) and the music was great.  If you're ever in the area check it out!!!

I had so much fun rollerskating here! I can't believe I hadn't been before. Great location, affordable skate rentals, very clean, etc. I also loved the music, it was a good variety for all ages. People seem to be respectful of the rules and others' space. The referee(?) was great and kept people in line and enforced the rules while still keeping the atmosphere fun. There is also a small arcade area which I didn't use, but may in the future, looked very fun.

Nice place for roller skating & has little arcade area too with pool tables & little area to purchase food, price is reasonable along with friendly atmosphere, dose get busy on weekends nights but good spot to bring the kids and watch them fall everywhere

Awesome rink! The owner cares about the rink and his customers, he took the time on a busy night to help replace and clean my bearings on my skates, he explained to me how to keep them clean and last longer!
The schedule is great too more availability!

place_name: Platinum City Gaming -Bar-Gaming Lounge- Arcade- Nerf Arena-Gellyball-Smash Room -Rage Room-Basketball
review_text: Great place. Fun atmosphere, the kids had a blast. The food was wicked good.  Freshest burger I've had in a while. Kids loved the pizza. Definitely have to come back again....possibly without the kids so we can try the drinks menu.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review and feedback we are happy you and the family had a great time . Hope you can visit again soon .

place_name: Platinum City Gaming -Bar-Gaming Lounge- Arcade- Nerf Arena-Gellyball-Smash Room -Rage Room-Basketball
review_text: Amazing staff, great atmosphere, always a good time, come here to play pool all the time, $12 for the table for two people and unlimited plays ain't a bad deal at all! They got a bar, plenty of games, plenty of things to keep both adults and kids entertained! Cant recommend this place enough!
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review and feedback means a lot .

place_name: Platinum City Gaming -Bar-Gaming Lounge- Arcade- Nerf Arena-Gellyball-Smash Room -Rage Room-Basketball
review_text: The owner is a very cool guy - friendly employees. Fun for kids and even adults.  Awesome little basketball court.  Very chill vibe - full bar.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review and feedback means a lot hope you visit again

place_name: Platinum City Gaming -Bar-Gaming Lounge- Arcade- Nerf Arena-Gellyball-Smash Room -Rage Room-Basketball
review_text: My son had a game card from a previous visit with $40 on it. When we went to use this we were told they changed their systems and the money already paid to this establishment was no longer available on the game card. The owner was very dismissive and offered no solution until I walked out the door and then he finally shouted he would offer me a free game play. Avoid spending money at this establishment that you will not use immediately.
response_from_owner_text: Hey Alyshia , Im so sorry we know longer use that card system anymore and we sent out emails and also made post on Facebook page and all other Social media pages to have all customers come in to use there old cards before it expires. The Owner offered to give you some free play games on the arcaded but you would not let him speak and you decided to leave . But im so sorry we upgrade our card system to make things even more fun for our customers . We Don't mind offering you some free games but we can't look in the old system anymore . Please ask for the Owner his Name is Rashaud he will take care of you .

place_name: Platinum City Gaming -Bar-Gaming Lounge- Arcade- Nerf Arena-Gellyball-Smash Room -Rage Room-Basketball
review_text: Kids and adults have alot of fun. Birthday was great. The food is delicious. Plenty of games. Bumper cars was fun. Staff is friendly & always helpful & kind. I highly recommend bringing your kids. It's super affordable
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review and feedback and happy everyone had a great time .

place_name: Platinum City Gaming -Bar-Gaming Lounge- Arcade- Nerf Arena-Gellyball-Smash Room -Rage Room-Basketball
review_text: I can't believe I've lived in Taunton for 10 years and never knew about this place. On top of that, I used to drive by this place ALL THE TIME for work (now I don't) or go to the Dollar Tree which is RIGHT NEXT DOOR to it but I figured it was like a video game place for kids and this WHOLE TIME they have a variety of activities to do for adults and kids and they have a smash room that I've always wanted to go to and never been. From the pics that I've seen, it looks like a fun place to be in the T. I'll def will be going and bringing my son!
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review and feedback means alot hope you can visit again soon

place_name: Platinum City Gaming -Bar-Gaming Lounge- Arcade- Nerf Arena-Gellyball-Smash Room -Rage Room-Basketball
review_text: My husband and I had a great time in the smash room! The safety gear was clean, they gave us plenty of bottles, and we had fun using the variety of bats, sledgehammers, and golf clubs to break the bottles. We can't wait to go back!
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review and feedback happy you had a great time

place_name: Platinum City Gaming -Bar-Gaming Lounge- Arcade- Nerf Arena-Gellyball-Smash Room -Rage Room-Basketball
review_text: PLATINUM GAMING WITH THE NEW RENOVATIONS WAS ALL THAT!!  THE KIDS AND I HAD A BALL PLAYING DODGEBALL AND RIDING THE BUMPER CARS STAFF WAS AMAZING AND DERICK WAS FRIENDLY AND VERY HELPFUL.... THE PIZZA OOH MAN GOOD PIZZA  EVERYTHING WAS FUN COMFORTABLE AND AFFORDABLE DEFINITELY WORTH IT AND WILL BE BACK AGAIN
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review and feedback Means a lot . Happy everyone had a wonderful time. Hope you can visit again soon .

review_text: Buenas

A year on the waiting list finally passed, did the orientation yesterday a very pleasant group of people. Went today and I was all alone, had the whole place to myself, how great is that? Very pleased.
One of the best indoor range. Be a member if you are near. Recommended
24/7 open indoor gun range... Need i say more. I love it. Get you're practice in every day.

24hrs is what really makes this place shine. Only if able to use large rifles indoors would this make this place untouchable.  The outdoor range is nice, plus the club does a lot of good for the community and the kids.

Great Private Gun Club with two indoor Ranges(one modern the other older as backup incase the ventilation and water carbon reducing filtration system goes down.  Don't like indoor? No problem. Drive less than 1.5miles down the road and you'll have arguably more fun outdoors between the 50/100/and 300 (if qualified) yard ranges.; need I say more? *Bang* *Bang*
Very good club for indoor shooting. The club has good shooting lanes.
Excellent club.  23 fifty foot indoor lanes for pistols, rimfire rifles, and air rifles.  Open for members 24/7
Great place. Lots of lanes.  Manual target system but 24*7 access via pass card access.

place_name: Amie's Playground in Massasoit State Park
review_text:
Massasoit needs to up it's employee efforts. The camping matches it's playground..
I used to come here a lot, but lately it's gotten bad. The grass and surrounding area is overgrown and full of trash. There were soda cans all over. There are also older kids that play on the younger kid things and make it nearly impossible for the little ones to safely play.
You can do better, Massasoit.

place_name: Amie's Playground in Massasoit State Park
review_text: Love the flat rubber at this park -- makes it easy to drive the stroller on. Lots of fun toys for all ages: my older kids and my toddler love it. Two downsides: 1. There's not much shade here during midday hours so early morning or evening are better times to go. 2. There are two zip lines, but one is broken and there are no traditional swings for older kids. However there are a couple of toddler swings and one disc swing, but older kids looking for a regular old swing won't find it here. There are so many other things that are fun here (rock wall, big climbing toy, teeter totter, zip line slides, etc) that the kids will still be engaged for hours.

place_name: Amie's Playground in Massasoit State Park
review_text: This playground is awesome.  Nice rubber under foot.  Has a small zip line swing.  It's not a huge playground but has different stuff that regular playgrounds

place_name: Amie's Playground in Massasoit State Park
review_text: The park was great, the children have lots of things to keep them busy. It's also great to see the growth of the different playground toys.

place_name: Amie's Playground in Massasoit State Park
review_text:
Perfect little playground.
Lots a returning friendly faces.
Picnic tables rt outside the play area & restroom nearby

place_name: Amie's Playground in Massasoit State Park
review_text: Many rides to keep any child entertained.

place_name: Amie's Playground in Massasoit State Park
review_text: All this place would need is a splash pad and seriously it would be perfect

place_name: Amie's Playground in Massasoit State Park
review_text: Took 2 yo granddaughter.  She loved it!

What a gem of a park.  I wish it didn't close at 4pm.  I even found a friend!!!!

Lots of parking, trails, picnic tables and grills, and even a tiny museum!

I super appreciate the BIG sign reminding visitors to leash dogs (thank you!!!)

Please leash your dogs!!!!!
Even on a cold and dreary day, this park will always be one of my local favorites. So many different paths and interesting things to see.
.great spot if I'm looking to do a quick walk with my dog.. quiet ,beautiful views, and not to many people.  They close the gate at 4 is my only issue.

It's a nice state park, kind of in the middle of nowhere. Unfortunately they Dighton Rock is in a cement building and closed for Covid. It doesn't seem like it's routinely open as there is a sign in the parking lot with a number to call to request access. There were to parks trucks in the parking lot when I visited... they don't allow swimming... so I guess you can go for a walk here.
Beautiful park and lake. We went there to take my girlfriends son's senior pictures and it was a great photo spot!
Great spot by the river, trails not too long and we'll maintained. Wish the museum was open. I called the number to make an appointment and it was disconnected,

Great spot for a hiking/nature walk. Lots of thorns and mosquitoes this time of year but thats to be expected. About 30 minutes into the trail we stumbled upon a massive pile of animal droppings. Judging by the size it must be from a large animal, unsure what might be in woods. Be safe & wear bug spray!!
I love this state park! It's right by the water! And there is plenty of path's in the wooded area. There is also day sites where you can relax for the day with a charcoal grill.

Boyden Park is the most inspiring and diverse park that I've ever visited. It offers a lake, short trails, long trails, open fields, thickets, picnic tables, boulders, boardwalks, bridges, and stairs winding up, down, around the hills, and along the water. The park is a romantic getaway, a meditation center, a family picnic, or, perhaps, the source for the Great American novel.

I saw at least a dozen dogs, and ALL were LEASHED!!!! Thank you Taunton!!!  You have no idea how amazing it is for someone medically fragile (I have Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, which is like brittle bone syndrome except it's my ligaments and tendons, not my bones, which are fragile) to be able to FREELY enjoy the park!!!!

The quiet and fresh air were so so refreshing, and I wouldn't have come if even one dog had been off leash (friendly dogs are the reason I dislocated my hip).

So so grateful for dog parents who share the space, and show respect!

This place has plenty of parking, a large picnic area, a children's garden, and a variety of trails and restrooms (though those close around 4pm, while the park is open later).

There's even a bird conservation area when you enter, and it is so peaceful.

I couldn't make it the 1.5 miles in, but maybe I'll work up to it as my body heals.  Not flinching with anxiety every time a dog appears will help that.

THANK YOU dog parents !!!  Thank you park for enforcing this necessary measure!!!

I recently visited Boyden park with my family and was impressed. Lots of picturesque views and most of main pathways were well maintained. The atmosphere here was quite peaceful and we felt completely at ease during our walk.

The picnic tables were clean, lots of trash cans in the picnic area and the porta potty on site was usable. Lots of great little fishing spots and places to launch a canoe. Would highly recommend as a great place to explore for those who like to follow trails.

Beautiful entrance but unfortunately that's all I got to see. I didn't realize you had to hike a bit and only had some time during my lunch break to kill. Would love to see what lies beyond with the trails. I didn't research it much before I went. But to pull in and park.. you won't be seeing much. But there are trails heading in all directions that lead to what appears to be Beautiful areas!
Phantom of my deceased wife floating in middle of the river. Not a great time. Caught this cool fish tho!
Great place for a hike.  Some cool things to see along the way

A perfect little nature walk for a family to go on. My kids really loved the fairy garden, which coincides with the perfume garden path. It's winter, so it was different this time of year, but i can imagine how lovely it is in the spring or summer. What a hidden gem this place is for kids who want to explore and find the hidden fairy houses. I will be coming back again.

nice place for>
walking trails, cycling, kayaking, picnicking.

Plenty of shady trails , plenty of field space to soak up some sunlight

This place is awesome. The kids loved it. The ramps and jumps are incredible. The people that work there are super helpful and friendly. They helped us purchase a helmet with no pushy demands and actually helped my sons friend find one that fit his big head. Plenty of seating for parents. The bleacher section is really cool. You can watch everyone riding and not be right in front of them and bothering anyone. Plenty of drink machines and snacks. The one and only thing I would suggest is more of a food option. I get it if that is something they don't want to do though. Adding food requires allot more work which might not be worth it. Awesome place though. Would recommend to anyone wanting to have fun at an indoor skate park. My son is always asking to go back.
Saturday, July 8th - Facility was great, lots of ramps for all skill levels. Staff was amazing, helpful, kind, and lighthearted.  Kids had a great time.

I drive over an 1:20 minutes to get here. I love coming here as the staff are nothing but polite and knowledgeable. The community that use the park as well are nothing but a pleasure to ride with. Im not an expert but i have hours of fun and the drive is well worth it. Plus they play really great music!
Friendly staff. Reasonable prices. Clean establishment. As much different ramps as you can fit in 30,000 square ft. Indoors!! Rain sleet or snow you can have fun.

A great place for all ages to play indoors! There is an enormous main area with a ton of options. From a 4' ramp to roll in from to an 8' quarter pipe to drop in from. There's a good size half pipe, a pool, a foam pit, and lots more!
It also has a smaller warm up area for new riders to learn some of the basics.
Reasonable prices and a pro shop round it out to make The Edge a new favorite winter play space to bring the kids and develope some skills of my own.
Great place wish it was closer to home but worth the ride.  Good people run this very nice and helpful.

We have nothing but wonderful things to say about the Edge. My two small children were welcomed by all the seasoned skateboarders. I have two children who take lessons with Jacob regularly and are improving all the time. They came into skateboarding willing to learn and fall, but the edge has given them a place to grow there skills even in the miserable New England weather. The staff has always been respectful and helpful especially in the skate shop(thanks Paul)!  Truely a great group of people!

Great staff! Large lot of assorted ramps for skateboards, BMX, scooters, and rollerblades. Spectator and dining areas.  Foam landing section. Affordable rates and available rentals for the entire place during off hours. A unique and enjoyable experience!

It isn't a house!!!! You'll drive by and think "uh...why is this taking me into someone's backyard?!"  It isn't.

The state bought the land.

There is a fenced-in yard to let your dog run wild, and then a lovely reminder to LEASH dogs while on the trail.

My body wasn't up for much walking, but I wanted to scout out the local parks and this one is a keeper :-).

Not a ton of parking, and you do have a decent slant to go down to the trial, but the trails are wide, so you likely could take wheels here if you have an off-road wheelchair.

I grew up on this land,  it was sold to developer who couldn't develop and eventually sold to the state.  Huge amount of Indian artifacts have been found by our neighbor many decades ago, which we subsequently named the road we built after,  Arrowhead rd. A little bit of everything is out there.  Sand dune, swamp,  brackish river,  natural spring with a pond my grandfather excavated. Horse barn, Railroad tracks,  tressel Bridge,  gas lines,  woods, fields, and an abundance of wildlife.

Looks like a residence but a super nice state park with trails. There's a spot with a nice view by the water with a picnic table. It can get a little mucky during spring/ spring-like months but my dog and I enjoy walking here. There's also a fenced in area where dogs can play and run around!

Beautiful views and a great place to hike!! Very hilly and rocky, also right behind an agricultural school with huge open fields. It's also right near the Taunton river and there's a little picnic table to stop by. So much scenery, greenery, and beautiful spots!! Please respect our Earth <3

This park is so cute! There is a small circle that you can hike with small children- it passes by the architectural school and the river. There is also a path along the old railroad that extends to a bridge (please don't try and walk over it!). I think you can go in other directions too! So much exploring for the future.

This is such a beautiful area! We had never been before. We went to a birding event there. Nice area to walk and take in nature. There is a beautiful area with a picnic table by the water too. Even our puppy loved it! We will definitely be visiting again.

1/2 mile walk South along the railroad tracks takes you to an old train bridge with beautiful places to sit on the Taunton river.  If you also walk the periphery of the park, it totals 2 miles.  Not well known, few people.  Just across the river at the end of the bridge is a nice community park, see photos.

I felt wierd pulling into what looked like someone's driveway and then walking through their backyard. But this place was amazing. A rare jem that I wasn't expecting.
After just a short walk we saw the pond and a breathtaking view.
I wouldn't recommend bringing a stroller or a bike.

If your kids are ready to compete, you will greatly appreciate what BTT and Professor Jair Morselli offers them. If they are not ready but want to be, then you found the right place. We spent a few hours today with some like minded people/kids who are also slated competitors for Pan Kids 2024. Quality instruction. Technical. Age appropriate. Fantastic student to coach ratio. My son took Gold in at Pan Kids in 2023 and not by accident... H III still undefeated in 4 IBJJF tournaments (and over 20 consecutive tournament matches over the last year, many outside IBJJF) so we know a little bit about what a fighting dojo looks like. You will not be disappointed.

I started training at BTT about a month ago. I started with the women's only class that they have on Sunday's and absolutely fell in love with the sport. The ladies were all so friendly and made you feel very welcome. I ended up signing up for a membership after a few weeks and have not regretted it at all! Everyone at BTT is so kind, welcoming, and supportive. The coaches are knowledgeable and patient and truly want to see you succeed. I recommend this gym and this sport to anyone who is willing!

Absolutely amazing gym, great atmosphere, great people , the owner is extremely nice and always willing to help. I started training in Febuary (3 months ago) in only the women's class on Sundays and 1 week later I was training 3 days a week in addition to the women's class this gym has changed my life! I've met some very good people , friends, and training partners. The way the owner runs the gym is exactly how a gym should be operated ! If you're thinking about getting into jujutsu this is the place to go !!

I started training at Brazilian Top Team Taunton roughly five months ago. From the first day, everyone was extremely welcoming. The coaches are knowledgeable, friendly and supportive. The other students are equally so, thanks to the atmosphere the gym encourages.

Whether you're looking for a workout, discipline, to compete or for a self-defense strategy, you'll find the path to what you're seeking at BTT Taunton with Jair Morselli and his team. There are classes for all ages and abilities, so anyone can come check it out and see if it's right for themselves and/or their families. I really can't recommend this gym and this sport enough.
response_from_owner_text: Hello Michelle, how's it going? Thanks for your feedback. We're committed to fostering a friendly environment and actively growing one of the most significant women's programs on the south coast, with you as a vital part of our team. Your support, along with everyone else's, means a lot to us. Excited about the bright future ahead. Thank you!

review_text: After training at multiple gyms this is by far the most welcoming gym around. With a phenomenal coaching staff both the kids and adults program is top class. Not a bad person in the gym and I've been blessed to learn a lot a continue to grow class by class. Huge thank you to coach Jair and the BTT family

My husband and I moved from the West Coast and were looking for a quality, established, and competitive gym in the SE region of Mass. We tried out multiple gyms in 40 miles radius and when we walked into BTT Taunton we knew it was the gym for us.
Why did we pick this gym? Involved and hands on professor- who is still active in the comp scene, freedom and encouragement to cross train, self paced environment, classes 7 days a week, talented and diverse student population (beginners, wrestlers, MMA, judokas, competitors, women's team, huge kids classes) so many people to learn from.

Jair goes above and beyond to make people feel welcome and apart of the team. You can see him bouncing around to each student helping them troubleshoot parts of their game or strategize their rounds. It's very impressive the way he makes the time for everyone.

So glad to be apart of this team!
response_from_owner_text: Hello Stacia, big thanks for the fantastic feedback. We consider ourselves fortunate to welcome you and Nick to the team; you both bring valuable contributions. Your involvement in the women's and kids' programs is truly appreciated. Our aim is to maintain a balanced 50-50 program between Gi and No Gi, with a special emphasis on evolving our No Gi with a wrestling foundation. Looking ahead to 2024, we're excited to introduce more Gi takedowns, bringing in Judo black belts to enhance our team's skills. Your efforts mean a lot, and we hope to have you as part of our family for many years to come. Appreciate everything you've done!

review_text: So appreciative to have found this gym. Professor Jair is a class act welcoming me into his gym with open arms at BTT Taunton. He goes above and beyond to help everyone and has excellent knowledge in the sport of BJJ. There are unbelievable athletes that train here and the environment is extremely welcoming. I would highly recommend for all levels. If you need good competition and great technique, this is the place to be!!

Very friendly environment! Perfect for anyone looking to learn quality Jiu-jitsu, instructors are very knowledgeable and helpful and they have great kids classes. Highly recommend to train at this gym!

The updated play area for the children is really great. The pool is great besides the splash pad which is barely ever open . I enjoy the small gym area. I wish they would fix the wooden steps. They recently moved the kids room again. Now the kids room is downstairs right next to the Zumba room. The kids room sounds like a damn club. You can't hear anyone talking and I'm afraid my daughter's hearing can get some damage if she's in there for long. I really love the YMCA, but I wish they would have the kids room in a safer, more calm quiet area.

Unfortunately I can't give zero stars.  This place is an absolute disaster unless you're there for the pool or child care, which seems to be all they care about; whatever brings them the most money.  Freezing cold showers.  Tiny, decrepit, and unsafe weight room, which of course was also downsized for more kid space.  Equipment in both the weight room and main fitness area missing bolts and falling apart.  Treadmills not cared for and slip which is a knee injury waiting to happen.  Not to mention endless lawsuits waiting to happen for that and everything else.  Unsupervised children everywhere; to include my wife's car getting hit with a basketball multiple times in the private lot out back last week.  All staff (fitness, lifeguards, front desk, etc.) constantly on their cell phones and not doing a single bit of work.  As for the credibility of this review, I worked at this Y for 9 years (held to much higher standards then), have a BS in exercise science, worked for years as a personal trainer, worked on fitness equipment for over a year, and currently manage a gym.  If you must go to a Y, do yourself a favor and make the drive up 44 to Middleboro, since Taunton is an absolute embarrassment.

The YMCA used to be awesome. I had the family membership for a year using my military discount. Something went wrong on their end with their billing system where the military discount was removed. I called the Taunton branch 4 times and spoke to 4 different people, never once getting a call back about the status of the problem. We ended up canceling our membership. I wouldn't recommend the Taunton branch to anyone, their member service is LACKING.
The kids small pool is never ever open. Other than that I love the taunton y.

Their is not enough good things I can say good about this YMCA.  I have been living overseas for the last 27 years and it has been a pleasure to use this facility.  I use the pool at least 3-4 times a week.  I love to swim laps and no matter how many people are in the pool I have always had a lane to use.  The locker room is great.  I bring my own lock everyday and use the daily use ones.  They have many hooks in the locker which is nice when you have many items.  The staff is always kind and respectful to each and every person I see entering when I arrive.  It is great to see how the YMCA is still doing a great job still now.  I highly recommend anyone to use this facility for many areas of activity.
The bus driver that we have is quite amazing. My son just loves her. And he loves going to hang with his friends and always comes home with such great manners.

Mixed feelings about the place.   Lex was very informative about the different plans...but arriving later to tour was a whole different thing.  Front desk person was uninterested in assisting...wish Lex would have been there.  Loved the pool and all the classes available.

The YMCA is great. The daycare here is very good would highly recommend all the staff are great. They keep you updated with pictures and videos throughout most days to show you what your child is doing that day.

Nice place to go for a walk along the water. There are benches all along to sit and take in the nice view. The grass is well kept, plenty of trash barrels around. Sometimes there's different events going on.  Good place to fly kites with the kids, walk the dog, go for a jog. At night there's more than ample lighting.

Great views beautiful walking paths. Well lit with benches. Worth the time for a stroll overlooking the Taunton River. Easily walk from heritage park battleship and bicentennial Park where the Vietnam Wall is located.
Fall River has done a great job rebuilding the walkway and piers. Great place to walk and visit the Parks, Museum and Water front.
6/23  New Piers with .33 walking perimeter, seating, bike racks and beautiful views of Somerset, Braga Bridge and Fall River.
I was there during a rain storm so perhaps not the best time to see its true beauty.  But well maintained
I went for Rock the Dock it was awesome
Great addition to the boardwalk. Clean, relaxing and usually a nice cool breeze from the water. Try to get there at least once a week with our dog to take our walks in the fresh air.
Such a beautiful scenic area, a great addition to the boardwalk

We brought our two year old and she loved it! It is clean and well organized. She loved every area. The owner was super inviting, kind and helpful. Our toddler had a melt down when we were leaving and the owner blew bubbles for her. She was so patient and made our daughter very comfortable.
I came in with my children today! They had a great time and Ms. Jenn's music class was the best I have ever been to! We'll definitely be back! I also appreciate that you don't charge for adults.

What a wonderful new children's museum!!! My toddler had an absolute BLAST and as a SAHM, I went straight for annual membership! Haha. Lots to do, fun and educational, and even more to come as they're still building rooms! He had so much fun and it was such a good deal, we booked his 2nd birthday here for January. Sam was so nice and helpful as well. So happy this has opened up here in town!

Absolutely love this place! It is huge and perfect for children a wide variety of ages- I have rented the museum  twice to host my sons birthday party (once when he was 6 and then for his 9th birthday!)  Very spacious and multiple clean themed  play areas! Highly recommend checking it  out!
response_from_owner_text: You always host the best parties! See you soon!

review_text: Just had my daughters second birthday party here. We also did her first here! The place is super clean, there is so much for kids of all ages to do and the staff is so helpful and kind! It's truly a great spot to have a party! They have added so many more fun elements which all my party guests loved! Communication was great and the staff member who was there during our party helped woth anything we needed, but let us do our own thing, which I prefer over a scheduled party planner! Overall I would highly recommend place for a birthday party!

My children love the stay n play museum. There is lots for them to do and they especially love the theater room and market area. We have also been to a few birthday parties there and the kids had a blast!

We brought our 15 month old boy for his first time today. He had a blast playing with the other kids and we got a chance to talk with some of the other parents while the kids had fun. This is a place that as a parent its your job to watch your kids and play with them. This is not a daycare, it is more of a bonding experience for you and your kids to meet other family in a fun environment.

My 3 and 8 year old loved it here. There was enough to keep them both entertained. The staff was so kind and attentive. The "take what you need" rack in the entrance sets a lovely tone for the whole facility.  We'll definitely be back again.

If you're visiting its a horrible place, think the water is toxic and shoreline is radioactive.  If you're a local its a great place to live but the locals won't ever admit it.

I'm fairly sure I saw alligators especially over by snake river.  Very very dangerous for the kids!
Public boat ramp,went fishing,relaxing time on the water
Just like looking out onto the water. From frozen to melted..

I loved that We saw a good amount of wildlife including a bald eagle!  Unfortunately there were a lot of jet skis and speedboats around which made kayaking a little tricky at times.  Also, you may want to rethink coming here during covid times since no one is wearing a mask at the ramp and no one is distancing.  It was very crowded.  I also feel like there was no boating etiquette observed here.   Seemed like it was everyone for themselves as far as put in and take out of boats.

Great Lake to bring a boat to fish and hang with friends and family. There is limited space at the boat ramp so be prepared to wait a little in line on a busy day but for the most part there is a good flow of boats in and out. Have fun be safe everyone.
Good boat ramp open to the public. Popular fishing spot and home to a couple of Bald Eagles.

Lake Sabbatia is a lake surrounded by lakeside houses and is mostly used for fishing, canoing, kayaking, jet skis ect... The parking lot is of decent size (good for trucks with trailers) and has a boat ramp.  The view is beautiful at Sabbatia especially during sunset!
Nice lake.very scenic and the fish are always biting.there have been some big bass caught here.great boating .
My niece had her wedding now. It was a wonderful time, great scenery. Good food, ready, very nice. The Atlas fear they did a really nice job. I would recommend this, please to anyone.
1st time guest. Early in season, greens just aerated, but you can see they will be great. Interesting layout & variety of hole styles. A real treat to play!

Well maintained and groomed
.
Mostly all players are well mannered
.
Beverage cart is a great idea
.
Ps
......
Golf  is a waste of time
I was there for a work conference of about 60 people. The food was buffet style with great taste friendly service from the wait staff.

I found out this hidden gem was allowing public tee times this year through a friend. This course is beautifully maintained and has quite a challenging layout. The greens are super fast and sloped, making putting very difficult to get a read on. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Having drinks and food on the deck overlooking the 1st hole was great, definitely try their burgers. I hope they still allow public tee times again next year, because I highly recommend this course if you haven't played it yet!

Have been here twice once for a wedding 12 years ago and again last month for a baby shower. The place is absolutely gorgeous and the staff are second to none. Absolutely a beautiful golf course as well as a indoor venue for all different types of parties. They really make you feel comfortable and not rushed at all. I have had nothing but great experiences both times I attended events here 12 years apart the atmosphere was exactly the same each time
Highly recommend this place if your looking for a venue to throw a memorable function for any type of gathering

Very beautiful place, my knees had wedding. Yeah, reception, yes, it was very nice. The people that were working there was very helpful. Very polite and very policed. I had a great time with a wonderful, wonderful time.

At first glance this is a lush green course with wide fairways leading to ample greens just waiting to be attacked. Except there are bunkers placed every you're apt to land. And when you do land on a green, the surface is like glass, requiring a deft touch to get anywhere near the pin. Good luck with that. Oh, and the wide fairways? Illusions. The  rough encroached into the first cut leaving a much narrower area to land than is initially thought. If you're not perfect, the ball will be in deep grass.

Great biking trail. A lot of sections of boardwalk on the bottom section. Top section is a hill. Downhill trails are bike park quality moderate difficultly dirt jump/ free ride style trails. Also easy trails which can be used for uphill. Everything is very well maintained.
The hill section isn't very large though so it's quick down and frequently intersects other trails. The difficulty of features is easier than Pine Hills, Plymouth.

Amazing Rock; it Rocks! :) The walk to this giant rock is part of the fun, and it's a major geological feature for the nerd in us. Supposedly this Rock rolled around under the ice sheets as they retreated back in the days of the Ice Age (or Noah's flood?). Wow. :)
Lots of mountain bikers were there when we got there. Nice spot
Our favorite place to ride bikes so far! A little bit muddy from the rain yesterday, but the trails made it worth it. Cant wait to go back!
So many vines, but a nice walk. Would recommend to park at the JR High school. Enjoy!

Love Swansea Village Park!  Puddingstone Peaks 200' high are rock-climbable. 10+ miles of walking trails.  BMX Bike trails abound.  Two waterfalls within a 1/2 mile long pond with largemouth bass.  Car Top Boat accessable.  Enjoy!

Nice little hike but the trails need to be labeled better, got a little lost. Great single track bike trails for Mt biking. Be aware, we went the day after a lot of rain, so quite a few muddy areas and standing water that we had to  negotiate around on our hike, but worth the trip

if your GPS brings you to the church parking lot, take a left out of the parking lot and park behind the library! You will see the entrance to all the trails from there! Great little hike for different skill levels, including various mushrooms like chicken of the woods, a small waterfall and various ponds! Beautiful birds in the area as well

I can't be more grateful to Lima' Tae Kwon-Do school for all the confidence, discipline,  courage and fun that all the teachers and Master Lima have provided to my child and all the children there. My son is so proud everywhere he goes to always say he goes to the best Tae Kwon-Do school. I recommend  Lima' Tae Kwon-Do to every parent out there. They really care about your child and the kids love it.

This is a super fun karate school, I learned how to break my first bored here. Here they have fun but kids learn the importance of respect, discipline, determination and more. This place is so so so amazing 5 stars I definitely recommend!!!!

Master Lima and his team are truly amazing! Our son has a lot of anxiety and they have gone above and beyond to work with him and help him overcome his fears.

It's more than just martial arts; they teach discipline, respect, honor, confidence and sportsmanship.

We're looking forward to many more years of working with Lima's Tae Kwon-Do!

Our sons have been attending Lima's Tae Kwon-Do for over 6 years, and we can't say enough about Master Lima and his entire staff.  The instructors are wonderful at what they do.  They teach with patience, professionalism and motivation.  They know when and how to push the students to bring out their very best and we couldn't be happier.

Our son has been a student at Lima's Tae Kwon Do for over 4 years.  Master Lima and his staff don't just focus on skill but, also on character, good sportsmanship, and respect. We have had a very positive experience, and this is hands down the best thing we have ever invested in for our son. We love and respect all the Lima's TKD staff and appreciate the difference they are making in our son's life.

Our son has been attending classes since he was 3 years old and we have had a wonderful experience! Mr. Lima and the entire staff are professional and extremely knowledgeable. They are incredibly patient with the children while also teaching them value lessons of hard work and respect. We are looking forward to many more years at Limas!

Lima's Tae Kwon Do is a wonderful school. Mr. Lima and his staff are amazing. They work hard to teach their students martial arts and work even harder to encourage them to be healthy, confident, strong and respectful. I highly recommend them!

My Daughter absolutely adores this class.  She is super energetic and we always look for ways to use it positively.  look not Further.  Mr. Lima is extraordinary in that he knows how to make them focus, think and use that energy properly.  Its more than Martial Arts here... its just something very different and very good!!!  keep up the great work!!!

come experience the difference.

place_name: Boys & Girls Clubs of Metro South - Taunton Clubhouse
review_text: My 7 year old whom suffers from trauma based behavioral problems after two months has been terminated 3 days before Xmas imagine telling a 7 she is not welcome back for the remainder of the school year!! A behavior plan was put into place just a few weeks prior then a two week probation meaning one behavior in that two week time is grounds for termination how realistic is that mind you it's kids watching kids they are not equipped or trained to deal with that many children that age they are in my 16 and this is who decides what is a behavior that constitutes a write up!! How are you helping my child by kicking her out what was the point of the plan nothing was.done any different in that short time really not even enough time for the child to adjust nevertheless 3 days before Xmas an vacation we are how without child care and my daughter feeling unwanted and hurt that she was so bad she says I can't even go back how awful my community resources am support would treat us this way !!

place_name: Boys & Girls Clubs of Metro South - Taunton Clubhouse
review_text: Tried.enrolling my.child.teice for after.school program and have got nothing but the run around, and didnt give.me a number to the.person I.needed to.contact. Had no.applications.to.fill.out avalible to.get.enrollment started. Terrible

place_name: Boys & Girls Clubs of Metro South - Taunton Clubhouse
review_text: It has bunch of stuff to do when your bored and they are like 1 big happy family

place_name: Boys & Girls Clubs of Metro South - Taunton Clubhouse
review_text: Place has no tv and so boring
